summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel and a law firm regarding a letter about a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence discusses forwarding the letter to the FBI to arrange an initial screening interview, noting the victim's counsel had previously advised she was not ready to be interviewed.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.context: Attorney from Marsh Law Firm PLLC who sent the initial email with an annexed letter concerning a potential Epstein/Maxwell victim to Audrey Strauss.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) who received the initial email from Jennifer Freeman regarding the victim letter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an alleged perpetrator of abuse against a potential victim mentioned in the annexed letter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as an alleged perpetrator of abuse against a potential victim mentioned in the annexed letter.

connections.description: Both are named together as alleged perpetrators of abuse against a potential victim in the context of the case.
Freeman, an attorney, sent a confidential letter regarding a potential victim to U.S. Attorney Strauss.

events.title: Victim Letter Forwarded
events.description: An email chain is initiated regarding an annexed letter from a law firm about a potential Epstein/Maxwell victim, which is forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Decision to Forward to FBI
events.description: A decision is made to forward the most recent victim letter to the FBI to arrange an initial screening interview.

events.title: Previous Counsel Advice
events.description: The victim's counsel had advised approximately a year prior (around 2019) that she was not in a position to be interviewed at that time.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: A law firm (Marsh Law Firm PLLC) sent a confidential letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The U.S. Attorney's Office planned to forward the victim letter to the FBI to arrange an initial screening interview.
The victim's counsel had previously advised, around 2019, that the victim was not ready to be interviewed.
The correspondence highlights ongoing investigative efforts in the Epstein/Maxwell case as of late 2020.
